abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            rated satisfactory. The lessons learned with the
            implementation of the Structural Adjustment Loan essentially
            confirm the broader international experience with economic
            reforms. 1) Transition to a market economy is a highly
            complex process. The experience of Kazakhstan also
            illustrates some of the challenges involved in charting and
            maintaining a feasible course of action, even when the
            strategic direction is clear. This is among others, because
            transition economies, even more than others, respond with a
            time-lag to the application of policy instruments, the
            length of which is hard to predict; and because for quick
            results, one cannot overly rely on actions, which require
            building up new institutional framework. 2) In this context,
            consistency of purpose on the part of the authorities and
            flexibility in execution are more important than detailed
            planning and scheduling in determining the success of
            transition strategies. Government commitment was certainly
            one of the hallmarks of the operation.

18225916.admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
18225916.theme: Other financial and private sector development,State-owned enterprise restructuring and privatization,International financial standards and systems,Other economic management,Macroeconomic management
18225916.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Economic management

abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Loan Project
            will facilitate a more rapid and effective restructuring of
            the enterprise sector -- crucial to both macroeconomic
            stabilization and recovery in output. The program supported
            by this loan focuses on steps to eliminate constraints that
            have been preventing such restructuring. Major measures are:
            liberalizing exports, dismantling monopoly holdings,
            facilitating entry of firms through land reform and exit of
            firms through foreclosure and bankruptcy, accelerating
            privatization, imposing financial discipline with isolation
            for 20 large distressed enterprises, and strengthening
            unemployment benefit policy to facilitate labor adjustment.
